person.persName: Thomas Allison Slayden (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer, postmaster, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer, postmaster, and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Letitia E. Beadles Slayden. Father of Lewis S. Slayden, Stokely W. Slayden, William J. Slayden, Martha Ann Slayden, Serena J. Slayden, and Jim W. Slayden. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed W. Jackson as a laborer in Graves County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Postmaster of Baltimore in Hickman County from March 1, 1854, to November 4, 1856. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Graves County in 1861.
